title: Sure, here is a reading list of 20 articles up to 2021 that focus on gathering annotations using crowdsourcing and different approaches to crowdsourcing for efficient label collection
**"The Wisdom of Crowds: Why the Many Are Smarter Than the Few"** by James Surowiecki
Although a book, it provides foundational insights into the principles behind crowdsourcing
**"Crowdsourcing Systems on the World-Wide Web"** by Aniket Kittur
A comprehensive overview of crowdsourcing systems and their applications
**"How to Use Mechanical Turk for Cognitive Science Research"** by Michael Buhrmester
Discusses practical guidelines for using Amazon Mechanical Turk for research purposes
**"Crowdsourcing User Studies with Mechanical Turk"** by Jonathan P
Examines the use of Mechanical Turk for conducting user studies
**"The Impact of Crowdsourcing on Research"** by Panos Ipeirotis
Analyzes the influence of crowdsourcing on various research fields
**"Crowdsourcing for Usability Testing"** by Jeff Sauro
Explores the use of crowdsourcing to gather usability data
**"Crowdsourcing Ground Truth for Medical Relation Extraction"** by Dina Demner-Fushman
Investigates the use of crowdsourcing for annotating medical texts
**"Crowdsourcing for Cognitive Science: The Utility of Smartphones"** by Jason E
Discusses the potential of using smartphones for crowdsourcing cognitive science experiments
**"Crowdsourcing the Acquisition of Natural Language Corpora: Methods and Observations"** by Chris Callison-Burch and Mark Dredze
Reviews methods for using crowdsourcing to collect natural language data
**"Crowdsourcing for Social Science Research: Applications, Methods, and Challenges"** by Winter Mason and Siddharth Suri
Provides an overview of crowdsourcing applications in social science research
**"Crowdsourcing for Speech Processing: Applications to Data Collection, Transcription and Assessment"** by Maxine Eskenazi
note: Gina-Anne Levow, Helen Meng, Grace Chia-Hui Lee, and Jun Zhang (2013

title: Discusses crowdsourcing applications in speech processing
**"Crowdsourcing for Subjective Annotation Tasks: A Case Study of Emotion Annotation"** by Saif M
Examines the use of crowdsourcing for annotating subjective data, such as emotions
**"Crowdsourcing for Relevance Evaluation"** by Omar Alonso and Stefano Mizzaro
Analyzes the use of crowdsourcing for evaluating the relevance of search results
**"Crowdsourcing for Large-Scale Semantic Annotation: The Case of the Google Books Ngram Viewer"** by Eitan Adam Pechenick
Explores the use of crowdsourcing for semantic annotation in large-scale projects
**"Crowdsourcing for Data Collection: A Review of Applications, Methods, and Issues in Geographic and Environmental Sciences"** by Alexander Zipf
publisher: Lars H. Griesbaum, and Peter Neis

title: Reviews crowdsourcing applications in geographic and environmental sciences
**"Crowdsourcing for Human Subjects Research: Ethical and Practical Considerations"** by Elizabeth A
Discusses ethical and practical issues in using crowdsourcing for human subjects research
**"Crowdsourcing for Large-Scale Data Collection in the Digital Humanities"** by Mia Ridge
Examines the use of crowdsourcing for data collection in the digital humanities
**"Crowdsourcing for Image Annotation"** by Yiling Chen, John Canny, and Leonidas Guibas
Investigates the use of crowdsourcing for annotating images
**"Crowdsourcing for Data Collection in Marine Ecology: Methods and Applications"**
Reviews crowdsourcing methods for data collection in marine ecology
**"Crowdsourcing for Data Collection in the Field of Education: A Review of Applications and Methods"** by Shari Trewin
Discusses the use of crowdsourcing for data collection in educational research
These articles and papers provide a broad overview of the various ways crowdsourcing can be used for annotation and data collection across different fields and applications
